page.title: 17PARTRIDGE GREEN'S GARAGE
page.content: PRETTY'S GARAGE,now at the junction of HIGH STREET and CHURCH ROAD but once on THE GREEN and called "THE CYCLISTS SHOP",is a long established feature of Partridge Green.It has two PUMPS supplying 2 and 4 STAR PETROL for CARS and a third used to supply LORRIES with DIESEL/DERV.Spare car parts can be bought and tyres filled with air.Mechanics maintain and repair cars and Ministry of Transport Tests are carried out.To attract more CUSTOMERS the garage sells paraffin for heaters,sweets,cigarettes and hires out video cassettes.In spite of it's attractions and friendly service it not particularly well used by villagers who because of infrequent and expensive PUBLIC TRANSPORT nearly all have their own vehicles.Perhaps it is because the petrol is not a well known brand.
